title-group.article-title: WHO PAYS DIVIDEND - AN EXPLORATORY ANALYSIS OF FIRMS LISTED WITH KARACHI STOCK MARKET

abstract.p: This paper empirically identifies the factors that influence the dividend decision of the firms listed with Karachi Stock Exchange using the firm wise data for 1980-86. The empirical findings validate the theoretical prediction that firms reach their targeted dividend payout gradually. However, in Pakistan all corporate activity is reflected in capital gains rather than in dividend. Unlike expected surpluses retained for investment and expansion purposes are not actualized atleast in short run. The results also envisage that the large size firms, firms with foreign ownership and private sector firms declare higher dividend payout. Surprisingly in our sample net profit after tax of the corporate firms does not ensure higher dividend payout.
